translated: 2Here is the corrected and aligned text:ğŸ”½MahÄprajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ-sÅ«tra, Scroll 37
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 9, Part 2: The First Ground, Perfect Joy
World-Honored One!
I do not see or perceive the five eyes and six supernormal powers as either accumulated or dispersed. How can one say these are the five eyes?
These are the six supernormal powers?
World-Honored One!
These names of the five eyes and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the names of the five eyes and so forth is already nonexistent, the names of the five eyes and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!
I do not see or perceive the self, sentient beings, up to the knower and seer as either accumulated or dispersed. How can one say this is the self, sentient beings, up to this is the knower and seer?
World-Honored One!
These names of the self and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Since the meanings of our names do not exist, our names all have no abode and are also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not see the Buddha-recollection, Dharma-recollection, Sangha-recollection, precept-recollection, relinquishment-recollection, deity-recollection, breath-recollection, disgust-recollection, death-recollection, or body-recollection as either accumulated or dispersed, so how can it be said that this is the Buddha-recollection up to this is the body-recollection?
World-Honored One!
These names of the Buddha-recollection, etc. all have no abode and are also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meanings of the names of the Buddha-recollection, etc. do not exist, the names of the Buddha-recollection, etc. all have no abode and are also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not see the arising or cessation of the notion of impermanence, the notion of suffering, the notion of non-self, the notion of impurity, the notion of death, the notion of the undesirability of all worlds, the notion of disgust with food, the notion of cutting off, the notion of separation, or the notion of cessation. How can it be said that this is the notion of impermanence up to this is the notion of cessation?
World-Honored One!
These names such as the notion of impermanence and so forth do not abide anywhere and are also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?

Because the meaning of the names such as the notion of impermanence and so forth does not exist, the names such as the notion of impermanence and so forth do not abide anywhere and are also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!
I do not see the arising or cessation of emptiness, signlessness, or wishlessness. How can it be said that this is emptiness up to this is wishlessness?
World-Honored One!
These names such as emptiness and so forth do not abide anywhere and are also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Since the meanings of emptiness, etc. do not exist, the terms emptiness, etc. all have no abode and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!

I do not see the accumulation or dispersal of generosity, precepts, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom. How can it be said that this is the perfection of generosity and this is the perfection of wisdom?
World-Honored One!
These terms for the perfection of generosity, etc. all have no abode and are also not without abode.
Why is it so?
Because the meanings of the terms perfection of generosity, etc. do not exist, the terms perfection of generosity, etc. all have no abode and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!

I do not apprehend the four establishments of mindfulness, four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of awakening, or eightfold noble path, whether combined or not, so how could I say 'this is the four establishments of mindfulness' up to 'this is the eightfold noble path'?
World-Honored One!
These names of the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth do not abide anywhere and are also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?

Because the meaning of the names of the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth does not exist, the names of the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth do not abide anywhere and are also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not apprehend the Buddha's ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, cognition of the path, or cognition of all aspects, whether combined or not, so how could I say 'this is the Buddha's ten powers' up to 'this is the cognition of all aspects'?
World-Honored One!
The names of the ten powers of the Buddha and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the names of the ten powers of the Buddha and so forth is non-existent, the names of the ten powers of the Buddha and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not see or perceive the five aggregates of clinging that are like an illusion, a dream, a reflection, an echo, a light and shadow, a flower in the sky, a mirage, a city of the gandharvas, a magical creation, or a transformation, either as assembled or dispersed. How can one say these are the five aggregates of clinging that are like an illusion and so forth?
World-Honored One!
The names of the five aggregates of clinging that are like an illusion and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?

Because the meaning of the names of the five aggregates of clinging that are like an illusion and so forth is non-existent, the names of the five aggregates of clinging that are like an illusion and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not see or apprehend quiescence, remoteness, non-arising, non-cessation, non-defilement, non-purification, the cessation of all conceptual proliferation, suchness, the dharma realm, the essence of dharmas, the ultimate reality, the nature of equality, or the nature of non-arising, either as assembled or as dispersed. How can I say this is quiescence up to this is the nature of non-arising?
World-Honored One!
These names for quiescence and so forth do not abide anywhere, nor do they not abide.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the names for quiescence and so forth does not exist, the names for quiescence and so forth do not abide anywhere, nor do they not abide.
World-Honored One!

I do not apprehend or see any dharmas, whether conditioned or unconditioned, whether with or without outflows, whether wholesome or unwholesome, whether with or without offenses, whether worldly or supramundane, whether belonging to saá¹ƒsÄra or nirvÄá¹‡a, as either arising or ceasing, either to be grasped or discarded, either to be known or not known, either to be cultivated or not cultivated, either to be attained or not to be attained. How can one say that this is permanent up to this belongs to the dharmas of nirvÄá¹‡a?ğŸ”½World-Honored One!ğŸ”½These names of permanence, etc. all have no abode and are also not non-abiding.

I do not apprehend or see any dharmas, whether conditioned or unconditioned, whether pleasant or painful, whether pure or impure, whether empty or not empty, whether with or without characteristics, whether with or without vows, whether calm or not calm, whether separated or not separated, whether defiled or pure, whether arising or ceasing, whether belonging to the realm of form or the formless gods, whether belonging to the realm of the Bra

I do not apprehend any dharmas, whether past, future, or present, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or neutral, whether belonging to the desire, form, or formless realms, whether pertaining to training, the untrained, or neither, whether to be abandoned through vision [of the four noble truths], cultivation, or not to be abandoned, whether internal or external, or whether in the middle, as being collected or dispersed. How can it be said that this is past, up to this is in the middle?
World-Honored One!
These names of the past, etc. all have no abode and are also not without abode.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the names of the past, etc. is already non-existent, the names of the past, etc. all have no abode and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!

I do not apprehend or see the assembly or dispersal of all TathÄgatas, Arhats, Samyaksaá¹ƒbuddhas, Bodhisattvas, and ÅšrÄvaka Saá¹…ghas in the worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the ten directions. How can I say this is the worlds in the ten directions, up to this is the ÅšrÄvaka Saá¹…gha, etc.?
World-Honored One!
The names of the worlds in the ten directions, etc. are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?

Because the meaning of the names of the worlds in the ten directions, etc. is already non-existent, the names of the worlds in the ten directions, etc. are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!
I do not apprehend or see the assembly or dispersal of the above-mentioned dharmas. How can I say this is a Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva?
This is prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ?
World-Honored One!
I do not apprehend either bodhisattva-mahÄsattva or prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, so how can I instruct and teach bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas with a dharma that is associated with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ?
Therefore, if I were to instruct and teach bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas with this dharma, I would certainly regret it.
World-Honored One!
The causes and conditions of dharmas are combined to establish the provisional names of bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
These two provisional names cannot be spoken of in the five aggregates, in the twelve sense fields, the eighteen elements,
the six elements, the four noble truths, or the twelve links of dependent arising. They cannot be spoken of in relation to greed, ill-will,
ignorance, all the bonds, latent tendencies, views, and unwholesome roots, etc.
They cannot be spoken of in relation to the four concentrations, four immeasurable [minds], and four formless concentrations.
the five eyes and six supernormal knowledges are indescribable, and the self, sentient beings, up to the knower,
and seer are indescribable, and the ten recollections and ten perceptions are indescribable, and the emptiness,
signlessness, and wishlessness of the six perfections are indescribable, and the four establishments of mindfulness up to
the eightfold noble path are indescribable, and the ten powers of the Buddha up to omniscience are indescribable,
and the illusory up to the magically created five aggregates, etc. are indescribable,
and the quiescence, remoteness, non-arising, non-cessation, non-defilement, non-purification, cessation of all frivolous

discourses, suchness, dharma realm, dharma nature, reality limit, equality, and nature of non-production are indescribable, and the dharmas of permanence and impermanence up to belonging to saá¹ƒsÄra and nirvÄá¹‡a are indescribable,
and the dharmas of the past, future, present up to being inside, outside, or in between are indescribable,
It is said that in the worlds of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, the buddhas, bodhisattvas,
and the assembly of Å›rÄvakas, etc., are indescribable.
Why is this?
Because the arising and ceasing of all dharmas as explained above are all unobtainable and invisible.
World-Honored One!

As explained above, the names of the five aggregates and so forth have no place to be spoken. In the same way, the names of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas and prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ also have no place to be spoken;

As the names of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and insight of liberation have no place to be spoken, in the same way, the names of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas and prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ also have no place to be spoken;

As the names of the stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, pratyekabuddhas, tathÄgatas, and their dharmas have no place to be spoken, in the same way, the names of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas and prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ also have no place to be spoken.
World-Honored One!
Just as all things, whether named or nameless, have no place to be spoken of, so also the name of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ have no place to be spoken of.
Why is it so?
Because these names do not abide anywhere, nor do they not abide.
Why is it so?
Because these names and meanings do not exist, therefore these names do not abide anywhere, nor do they not abide.
World-Honored One!
I rely on this meaning, therefore in all dharmas I do not see either their aggregation or their dispersal. How can it be said that this is the name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
This is the name of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ?
World-Honored One!
Since I do not see either the meaning or the name of these two, how can I cause me to teach and instruct the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas with the Dharma that accords with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ?
Therefore, if one teaches and instructs the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas with this Dharma, there will certainly be regret.
World-Honored One!

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, when hearing the explanation of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in this manner, their minds do not become depressed or sorrowful, and their minds are not startled, frightened, or terrified, one should know that these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have definitely already attained the stage of nonretrogression, abiding through the skillful means of nonabiding.
At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in form, should not abide in feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
Form is empty of the nature of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty of the nature of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.
World-Honored One!

Form is empty of form, and the emptiness of form is not other than form. Form is not separate from emptiness, and emptiness is not separate from form. Form is precisely emptiness, and emptiness is precisely form. Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are also like this.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in form, should not abide in feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.
World-Honored One!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the eye sense base, should not abide in the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense bases.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
The eye sense base is empty of the nature of the eye sense base, up to the mind sense base is empty of the nature of the mind sense base.
World-Honored One!

The emptiness of the eye-base is not the eye-base, the eye-base is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the eye-base, the eye-base itself is emptiness, emptiness itself is the eye-base. The same is true for the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-bases.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the eye-base, up to should not abide in the mind-base.
World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the form-base, should not abide in the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas-base.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
The form-base is empty of the nature of the form-base, up to the dharmas-base is empty of the nature of the dharmas-base.
World-Honored One!

This form realm is not the formless realm, this form realm is empty, the formless realm is not the form realm, the formless realm is empty, the form realm is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the form realm, the form realm is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the form realm. The realms of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas are also like this.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the form realm, up to should not abide in the dharma realm.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the eye element, form element, eye consciousness element, and eye contact, or the feelings produced by the condition of eye contact.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
The eye element, eye element nature is empty, up to the feelings produced by the condition of eye contact, the feelings produced by the condition of eye contact nature is empty.
World-Honored One!

The eye element is not empty of the eye element, the eye element is empty of the eye element, the eye element is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the eye element, the eye element is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the eye element. The same is true for the form element up to the eye contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the eye element, up to should not abide in the eye contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the ear element, sound element, ear-consciousness element, and ear contact and the feelings produced by ear contact as a condition.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
The ear element, ear element nature is empty, up to the feelings produced by ear contact as a condition, the feelings produced by ear contact as a condition nature is empty.
World-Honored One!

The ear-sphere is not empty of the ear-sphere, the emptiness of the ear-sphere is not the ear-sphere, the ear-sphere is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the ear-sphere, the ear-sphere is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the ear-sphere. The same is true for the sound-sphere up to the ear-contact as condition.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the ear-sphere, up to should not abide in the ear-contact as condition.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the nose-sphere, smell-sphere, nose-consciousness-sphere, and nose-contact, up to the feelings that arise from nose-contact as condition.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
The nose-sphere, nose-sphere nature is empty, up to the feelings that arise from nose-contact as condition, the feelings that arise from nose-contact as condition nature is empty.
World-Honored One!

The nose-sphere is not empty of the nose-sphere, the nose-sphere is empty of the nose-sphere, the nose-sphere is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the nose-sphere, the nose-sphere is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the nose-sphere. The same is true for the smell-sphere up to the nose-contact as a condition for the arising of feeling.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the nose-sphere, up to should not abide in the nose-contact as a condition for the arising of feeling.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the tongue-sphere, taste-sphere, tongue-consciousness-sphere, and tongue-contact as a condition for the arising of feeling.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
The tongue-sphere, tongue-sphere nature is empty, up to the tongue-contact as a condition for the arising of feeling, tongue-contact as a condition for the arising of feeling nature is empty.
World-Honored One!

The tongue sense-field is not empty of the tongue sense-field, the tongue sense-field is empty of the tongue sense-field, the tongue sense-field is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the tongue sense-field, the tongue sense-field is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the tongue sense-field. The taste sense-field up to the body sense-field and the tactile objects sense-field are also like this.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the tongue sense-field, up to should not abide in the tactile objects sense-field and the body sense-field.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the body sense-field, the tactile objects sense-field, the body consciousness sense-field, the body contact, or the tactile objects sense-field and the body sense-field as the condition for the arising of various feelings.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

The body sense-field is empty of the nature of the body sense-field, up to the tactile objects sense-field and the body sense-field as the condition for the arising of various feelings is empty of the nature of the tactile objects sense-field and the body sense-field as the condition for the arising of various feelings.
World-Honored One!

The body element is empty of the body element, the emptiness of the body element is not the body element, the body element is not apart from emptiness, emptiness is not apart from the body element, the body element is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the body element. The same is true for the element of touch up to the feelings that arise from the condition of body-contact.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the body element, up to should not abide in the feelings that arise from the condition of body-contact.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the mind element, the dharma element, the mind consciousness element, or in mind-contact, or in the feelings that arise from the condition of mind-contact.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

The mind element is empty of the nature of the mind element, up to the feelings that arise from the condition of mind-contact are empty of the nature of the feelings that arise from the condition of mind-contact.
World-Honored One!

This mind-sphere is not empty of the mind-sphere, this emptiness of the mind-sphere is not the mind-sphere, the mind-sphere is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the mind-sphere, the mind-sphere is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the mind-sphere. The same is true for the dharma-sphere up to the various feelings that arise from the condition of mind-contact.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the mind-sphere, up to should not abide in the various feelings that arise from the condition of mind-contact.
World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the earth element, should not abide in the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

The earth element is empty of the nature of the earth element, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are empty of the nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements.
World-Honored One!

This earth element is empty of the earth element, and this emptiness of the earth element is not the earth element. The earth element is not separate from emptiness, and emptiness is not separate from the earth element. The earth element is precisely emptiness, and emptiness is precisely the earth element. The water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are also like this.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the earth element, and should not abide in the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements.
World-Honored One!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the noble truth of suffering, and should not abide in the noble truths of the origination, cessation, and path of suffering.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

The noble truth of suffering is empty of the nature of the noble truth of suffering, and the noble truths of the origination, cessation, and path of suffering are empty of the natures of the noble truths of the origination, cessation, and path of suffering.
World-Honored One!

The noble truth of suffering is empty of the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of suffering is empty of that which is not the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of suffering is not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of suffering is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the noble truth of suffering. The noble truths of the origin, cessation, and path are also like this.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the noble truth of suffering, should not abide in the noble truths of the origin, cessation, and path.
World-Honored One!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in ignorance, should not abide in volitional formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, and anguish.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Ignorance is empty of the nature of ignorance, up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, and anguish are empty of the nature of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, and anguish.
World-Honored One!

This ignorance is not empty of ignorance, this emptiness of ignorance is not ignorance, ignorance is not apart from emptiness, emptiness is not apart from ignorance, ignorance is precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely ignorance, and the same is so for formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, dejection, and mental anguish.
Therefore, World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in ignorance, and so forth, up to they should not abide in old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, dejection, and mental anguish.
World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the four concentrations, should not abide in the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

The four concentrations, the nature of the four concentrations is empty, the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations, the nature of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations is empty.
World-Honored One!

The four meditations are not empty of the four meditations, the emptiness of the four meditations is not the four meditations, the four meditations are not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the four meditations, the four meditations are themselves emptiness, emptiness is itself the four meditations, the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are also like this.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the four meditations, should not abide in the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations.
World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should not abide in the five eyes, should not abide in the six supernormal knowledges.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
The five eyes are empty of the nature of the five eyes, the six supernormal knowledges are empty of the nature of the six supernormal knowledges.
World-Honored One!

The five eyes are empty of the five eyes, the emptiness of the five eyes is not the five eyes, the five eyes are not separate from emptiness, emptiness is not separate from the five eyes, the five eyes are precisely emptiness, emptiness is precisely the five eyes. The six supernormal knowledges are also like this.
Therefore, World-Honored One!
